action.action-desc: Mr. Calvert (for himself and Mr. Cuellar) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs and the Commissioner of Social Security to implement automated systems with callback functionality for each customer service telephone line of the Department of Veterans Affairs and the Social Security Administration, respectively, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stuck On Hold Act.

section.header: Improvements regarding wait times of callers to customer service telephone lines of certain agencies

subsection.header: Customer service telephone lines of the Department of Veterans Affairs

paragraph.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall implement for each customer service telephone line of the Department of Veterans Affairs an automated system that—

subparagraph.text: informs any caller to such a telephone line about the anticipated wait time, if any; and
automatically offers a callback to any such caller with an anticipated wait time of more than 15 minutes.

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall issue such guidance as is necessary to reduce the average wait time of callers to a customer service telephone line of the Department to not more than 15 minutes. All calls will be answered in the order in which they are received.

subsection.header: Customer service telephone lines of the Social Security Administration

paragraph.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Commissioner of Social Security shall implement for each customer service telephone line of the Social Security Administration an automated system that—

subparagraph.text: informs any caller to such a telephone line about the anticipated wait time, if any; and
automatically offers a callback to any such caller with an anticipated wait time of more than 15 minutes. All calls will be answered in the order in which they are received.

paragraph.text: The Commissioner shall issue such guidance as is necessary to reduce the average wait time of callers to a customer service telephone line of the Social Security Administration to not more than 15 minutes.
